intro: Semenovia gyirongensis, commonly known as the Gyirong bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine habitats at high elevations. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
